ApiCount.Description: The number of api web processes to run

ApiCpu.Description: How much CPU should be reserved by the API web process.

ApiMonitorMemory.Description: How much memory should be reserved by the api monitor process

ApiWebMemory.Description: How much memory should be reserved by the api web process

AutoscaleExtra.Description: The number of instances of extra capacity that autoscale should keep running

AvailabilityZones.Description: Override the availability zones used in the rack (specify 3)

BuildCpu.Description: How much cpu should be reserved by the builder

BuildInstance.Description: Instance type for a dedicated build cluster

BuildInstancePolicy.Description: ARN of an additional IAM policy to add to the cluster build instances

BuildMemory.Description: How much memory should be reserved by the builder

BuildVolumeSize.Description: Default build disk size in GB

CpuCredits.Description: The credit option for CPU usage of a T instance

EcsPollInterval.Description: How often to poll ECS for service events in seconds. Longer intervals may alleviate rate limiting / throttling from ECS.

EncryptEbs.Description: Enable encryption at rest for EBS volumes

ExistingVpc.Description: Existing VPC ID (if blank a VPC will be created)

NoHaInstanceCount.Description: The number of instances in the runtime cluster for no HighAvailable racks

HighAvailability.Description: Wether to create rack in High Availability mode.

HttpProxy.Description: Connect using an outbound HTTP proxy (for network-restricted Racks)

ImagePullBehavior.Description: The behavior used to customize the pull image process for your container instances. See ECS_IMAGE_PULL_BEHAVIOR https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/ecs-agent-config.html

IMDSHttpTokens.Description: You can set EC2 instances to use only v2 by setting IMDSHttpTokens as 'required', see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/configuring-instance-metadata-options.html#configuring-IMDS-new-instances

Internal.Description: Support applications that are only accessible inside the VPC

InternalOnly.Description: Only support applications that are only accessible inside the VPC

InstanceBootCommand.Description: A single line of shell script to run as CloudInit command early during instance boot.

InstanceRunCommand.Description: A single line of shell script to run as CloudInit command late during instance boot.

InstanceCount.Description: The number of instances in the runtime cluster for high available racks

InstancesIpToIncludInWhiteListing.Description: Instances Ip to be auto included in whitelisting when rack is public

InstanceType.Description: The type of the instances in the runtime cluster

InstanceUpdateBatchSize.Description: The number of instances to update in a batch

InstancePolicy.Description: ARN of an additional IAM policy to add to the cluster instances

InstanceSecurityGroup.Description: The security group to assign to the ECS instances.  If blank, convox will create a security group open to all IPs in your VPC

BuildInstanceSecurityGroup.Description: The security group to assign to the ECS build instances.  If blank, convox will use the same security group as the instances

InternetGateway.Description: The InternetGatway to route to if an Existing VPC is specified

Key.Description: SSH key name for access to cluster instances

LoadBalancerIdleTimeout.Description: The idle timeout value, in seconds. The valid range is 1-4000 seconds. The default is 3600 seconds.

LogDriver.Description: Log driver used by the rack and services to send logs. Default to CloudWatch. You must provide the SyslogDestination when setting as Syslog. It disable logs if blank.

LogRetention.Description: Number of days to keep logs (blank for unlimited)

MaintainTimerState.Description: Explicitly maintain time state. If use disable the timer, it will keep it disbaled

NoHAAutoscaleExtra.Description: When HighAvailability is set to false, the autoscale will maintain a certain number of extra capacity instances running on racks that are not configured for high availability

OnDemandMinCount.Description: The minimum number of on-demand instances in the runtime cluster

PrivateApi.Description: Put Rack API Load Balancer in private network

PrivateApiSecurityGroup.Description: Lock down private API to a security group

PrivateBuild.Description: Place only the build instances into a private network (unused if Private is Yes)

RouterInternalSecurityGroup.Description: The security groups (comma delimited) to assign to the internal rack router.

RouterMitigationMode.Description: Determines how the load balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your application.

RouterSecurityGroup.Description: The security groups (comma delimited) to assign to the rack router.

ScheduleRackScaleDown.Description: The recurring schedule for when the rack will be shutdown. This format consists of five fields separated by white spaces: [Minute] [Hour] [Day_of_Month] [Month_of_Year] [Day_of_Week]

ScheduleRackScaleUp.Description: The recurring schedule for when the rack will start. This format consists of five fields separated by white spaces: [Minute] [Hour] [Day_of_Month] [Month_of_Year] [Day_of_Week]

SslPolicy.Description: SSL policy for rack load balancer

SwapSize.Description: Default swap volume size in GB

SyslogDestination.Description: Syslog address destination, you need to pass the protocol to be used, e.g. tcp+tls://logsX.syslog.com:1234

SyslogFormat.Description: Syslog format (low case) to sent to SyslogDestination.

Telemetry.Description: Activate tracking rack parameters. This data will be send to convox infrastruture to help platform stability

WhiteList.Description: Comma delimited list of CIDRs, e.g. `10.0.0.0/24,172.10.0.1/32`, to allow access to the rack api. Maximum 4 CIDR can be specified.
